result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrianne Johnson

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($500.00) LW

Defendant Adrianne Johnson not in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Adrianne Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial. Defendant does not appear. Court issued a bench warrant. REMAND BACK TO JUDGE. Court forfeited $500.00 cash bail.

Defendant Adrianne Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-21-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Adrianne Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 8-18-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 9-21-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Note:  This entry was done in error.  Money was paid on 2022CM001492.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 06/08/2022

Note:  This entry was done in error.  Money was paid on 2022CM001492.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 06-08-2022

Defendant Adrianne Johnson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JM; TLT
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adrianne Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Adrianne Johnson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrianne Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
